Sentencas: Fast oxygen exchange kinetics, a key figure of merit in solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) electrodes, is often dramatically hindered by the presence of even small concentrations of impurities, for example, Si which is common 50 in ceramics processing.
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives

Sentencas: In this work, rapid degradation of oxygen exchange kinetics was found on dense thin films of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-delta (PCO), a mixed ionic electronic conducting 0 electrode for SOFCs, using a new optical transmission relaxation (OTR) technique which facilitates kinetics measurements of bare film surfaces (i.e., in the absence of current collectors typical of conventional measurements).
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives

Sentencas: Si was identified by TEM and XPS as a significant impurity, forming a blocking layer on the electrode surface.
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives

Sentencas: Full recovery of oxygen exchange kinetics on the measured samples was achieved after deposition of a La oxide film.
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives

Sentencas: Subsequent TEM studies indicate the formation of a porous La- and Si-containing film.
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives

Sentencas: Interaction between La and Si oxides was identified by a shift in the 0 is XPS peak and a systematic OTR study of films that likely react with Si (e.g., La, Sm oxides) and those that do not (e.g., Nb, Ti, Zn oxides).
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives

Sentencas: Preliminary measurements of OTR on a La-PCO solid solution indicates improved long-term electrode kinetics stability, demonstrating the commercial potential of this method to achieve Si impurity tolerance.
Titulo: Improving the Si Impurity Tolerance of Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-δ SOFC Electrodes with Reactive Surface Additives
